Key Arguments: The proposed legislation will erode freedom of speech, which is a fundamental human right and essential for a free and fair society.
Freedom of speech is crucial for the discovery of truth, as it allows for the free flow of information that can be tested and questioned.
The internet serves as a modern 'town square' for debating ideas, and government intervention as an arbiter of truth is not the solution.
The bill could halt essential dialogue and debate, which are necessary for societal and scientific progress.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is the bedrock of a free and fair society.
The proposed bill will effectively halt this essential dialogue.
Setting up the government as the arbiter of truth is not the answer.
